Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Atrioventricular Conduction Prolongation in Cardiac Pacing

Trial_Design.evidence: Conducted as a single-center, randomized controlled trial

Participants.evidence: cardiac surgical patients at risk of left ventricular failure post-cardiopulmonary bypass

Intervention.evidence: The intervention involved temporary BiVP optimization, with no specific control group.

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to estimate atrial conduction using AVCP and evaluate its role in optimizing paced atrioventricular delay (pAVD) during biventricular pacing (BiVP).

Method_Outcome.evidence: Primary outcomes were optimum cardiac output (OptCO) and mean arterial pressure (OptMAP), assessed immediately post-bypass.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization and allocation concealment methods were not detailed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding of outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians was not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Seven patients were randomized, with three assigned to the short-AVCP group (<64 ms) and four to the long-AVCP group (>64 ms).

Result_Outcome.evidence: OptCO and OptMAP were significantly lower in the short-AVCP group (p = 0.015 and p = 0.029).
